Hi,How are you?Yes it is quite possible that your symptoms are due to CFS or chronic fatigue syndrome. It usually follows a viral infection and is characterized by muscles aches and pains.Another possibility is fibromyalgia which causes muscle spasms, cramps and tingling and twitching muscles.You have mentioned 8 foci were seen on MRI. Where exactly are these foci?Please elaborate.

Thanks for your reply, i really really apreciate it....the report said a number of T2 hyperintensities are demonstrated in the subcortical and deep white matter of both cerebral hemispheres. these have no distingushing characteristics with the largest lesion situated in a right subcortical location superior to the posterior aspect of the sylvian fissure measuring 3mm. There are approximately 8 foci of signal change in total...................except for an incidently noted prominent cisterna magna. there is a 9mm simple pineal cystThank you look forward to your reply

Hi,Your MRI report indicates a number of white matter lesions. The white matter lesions can occur due to high BP, chronic headache, migraines, old age, diabetes, alcoholism, smoking, and Alzheimer’s disease and multiple sclerosis.It is very difficult to diagnose if these lesions are due to MS since your symptoms are also not clear cut.A follow up MRI after 6 months will help in diagnosing the exact cause of these white matter hyperintensities.Hope this helps!
Thanks so much its nice to have some insight really appreciate it....Once you have these lesions can you expect to get more...or are they likely to stay the same?

Hi,Yes it is possible to get more lesions or for the existing lesions to increase in size. If there is a progression in lesions it increases the chances that these lesions are due to demyelinating disease like MS.There is a equal possibility of these lesions to remain unchanged.
